file_content.text: Hm... I think I know where that is. I'll get some gear together and meet you out there, maybe provide backup.
I appreciate it.
Doesn't matter to me.
No backup is necessary.
Even so--I'd like to see Master Eriz for myself.
Still can't believe the Master Eriz I worked with is the same guy who's causing so much trouble.
What's happened here? It looks like some sort of massacre. Holiday! Don't look!
Is bad place, much dead here. Sand People hunters kill weak prey, have no honor.
Listen, Delk, we got broken vaporators, a pile of wounded, and our food stores are almost completely gone.
That lunatic said he was a Jedi and a friend of yours. We trusted him.
You better have a pretty good explanation for why this Master Eriz keeps sending Sand People out to attack us.
I think Master Eriz may be unwell.
I don't know why.
That's the Jedi I'm looking for. Where is he?
You've seen Master Eriz?
What's this about Sand People and Master Eriz? Explain yourself.
Whoa--slow down.
Another Jedi? Dammit, Delk, why do you keep leading them here?
L--listen here. We've already lost too much to that Master what's-his-face and his army of Sand People.
So why don't you just leave here quiet-like and don't cause any more trouble?
I don't want trouble--just tell me what's going on.
Let's all stay calm.
I'm not your enemy, so tell me where Master Eriz is.
[Force Persuade] I'm a friend.
This Jedi's not our enemy.
Sure, right... Master Eriz came through here a few weeks ago. Wanted to meet the Sand People and "study" them.
I will leave when I find Master Eriz.
Not without Master Eriz.
Why should we tell you a thing?
I'm sorry, Jedi, but our trust is a bit worse for the wear at this point.
Master Eriz was nice enough when he came through asking to "study" the Sand People.
But ever since we pointed him to their camp... you could set your chrono by their attacks. We got nothing left!
The Sand People are your enemies, not me.
I'm not the one to blame.
If you want to fight the Sand People, be our guest, but we got our hands full just defending the settlement.
Here's a map of their camp. Some of our guys scoped out a side entrance a while back.
You suggesting we go out there and attack the Sand People? You want us to get killed?
Then tell me where Master Eriz is so I can stop him. It's your only chance.
I'm your only hope.
For the last time, I am not in league with Master Eriz. Now tell me where he is before I get violent.
I'm losing patience.
Either you tell me where to find Master Eriz, or I become violent.
Show me the camp or else.
I promise you, Master Eriz will answer for his crimes, but you must tell me where this camp is.
Don't worry--I will stop him.
Yeah, sure. We can mark out a map for you, though it's hard to miss if you head out into the desert from here.
What, and let you help him with his plan to destroy us? I don't think so.
I promise I am not working with Master Eriz.
Trust me.
All right... I guess we don't have a choice. I'll draw you out a map.
In fact, some of our guys scoped out a side entrance you might be interested in.
It's a little less crowded, which could be all the difference. There's something weird about these Sand People--they seem faster and stronger than normal.
If you fools won't volunteer the information, I'll pry it out of you.
I wasn't asking.
Hey, hey now. Fine. No need for threats. I'll draw you a map.
Stopping Master Eriz may be your only chance of stopping the Sand People, but you need to tell me where he is.
I can stop the attacks.
You know it's true, Malcolm.
Okay. Fine. Seems we don't have a choice. I'll draw you a map, but I still don't trust you.
I'll warn you, though, Master Eriz did something to these Sand People. They're stronger, faster than any we've seen.
The Sand People are the oldest group on Tatooine? Doesn't say much for progress. Still, I bet none of them get the Sand Rot.
I have a hard time believing Master Eriz would do anything so cockeyed as working with the Sand People. At least the Jawas are good for droid repair.
He said it himself--he saw the vision on the wall and went to find the ultimate warriors.
I wish it weren't true.
I just need to find him, to make sure he's okay.
Let's not jump to conclusions.
What you think doesn't matter.
Wait... what did you say the symptoms of this thing were? Delusions, paranoia, violence?
One group of Sand People has been unusually aggressive lately. Normally, they stick pretty close to their camps.
I'm not saying I think Master Eriz is behind it, but... maybe it's worth looking into.
So where would I find these Sand People?
How would I do that?
Now you're starting to use your brain.
Finally--a sensible thought.
I can only go by what I've seen of the man. I'm sorry.
Believe me, I want to be wrong about Master Eriz.
I hope he's not.
There's a farming settlement out at Malcolm's Dunes that's been reporting a lot of Sand People activity.
I'll meet you out there. I know some of those folks, and I can help your investigation.
I thought you weren't supposed to go out into the desert.
What about your health?
Says who? Bunch of doctors never set foot outside of Anchorhead in their lives.
See you there.
Good. I'm itching to get to the bottom of this.
I appreciate the help, but I'm sure I can do without it.
Do what you like.
People in the desert don't take well to strangers, and if Master Eriz is stirring the Sand People up, they won't like a Jedi one bit.
Besides, it'll do me good. Don't care if it kills me, I'm tired of being an invalid.
Jedi! Did it work? Did you see Master Eriz's vision?
What Master Eriz saw wasn't mystical at all--it was a carving made by the Sand People.
Eriz didn't have a vision.
It was glorious--the Force revealed its secrets to me.
Yes, I did.
Amazing. What did you see?
There was no vision--just a lousy wall carving.
No, I didn't.
A carving? Master Eriz never mentioned a carving on those walls. What did it show?
Let's see if I can explain this...
I'll describe it.
Just some Sand People, fighting some kind of battle....
Not much.
The Sand People conquered everyone on Tatooine....
The ultimate warriors.
I'm listening....
That meditation site is our best bet, Jedi. Check it out.
Master Eriz used to take lights out to a cave near the rock pillars at night and meditate.
Sounds like that's when he had his vision. You're a Jedi. Maybe you could do the same thing.
Visions don't exactly work that way, but I should have a look at this meditation site.
It's worth investigating.
It's the best lead I have.
I guess it's worth a try.
That's not how visions or the Force work.
That's an idiotic idea.
Well, I don't know what to tell ya--all we know is that Master Eriz saw something in that cave.
He sent me this message for a reason. He don't know these tyrants are keeping me under lock and key.
Maybe he expected me to go... left some indication of where he went... case I decided to follow.
Where can I get some lights?
And the lights?
I guess it's worth a look.
That's a pretty serious cough.
Are you okay?
Nah, it's nothing. Just... just the Sand Rot acting up. Dirt in the lungs. I'm fine.
You can use my old tracking flares as lights. That cave gets pretty dark.
Just be careful out there--rumor is the Sand People are getting riled up. Don't let 'em catch you with your lightsaber sheathed.
Ho, there, Jedi! Would you look at this? They're letting me walk around the clinic. Soon they might let me cross the street by myself!
Any luck finding Master Eriz?
I didn't find him, but the Jawas said he made this for you.
He left a message for you.
Will you take a look at this holorecording?
Hopefully this will help.
I went all that way, and all I got to show for it is an encoded holorecording.
That was a waste.
What's this? A message from Master Eriz? I know this encryption... shouldn't take long to crack... there!
Care to see what he has to say?
Rowan, you've realized by now that I've left those most resourceful of creatures, the Jawas, in pursuit of greater things.
I came to Tatooine to discover the secret to life--not its creation, but its ongoing survival. How do some species thrive while others fail?
A great darkness is coming, Rowan, and to withstand it, we must know the answer to that question.
That phrase is familiar. Has Master Eriz spoken of this darkness before?
"Darkness is coming"?
Not to me, but there's more here. Maybe he explains it.
He chose a strange place to start.
So why study the Jawas?
Like I said, he saw something in those critters. He had such a way with them.
An interesting concept....
Fascinating.
I believed that the Jawas, whose enduring civilization thrives in spite of Tatooine's harsh conditions, would answer that question.
Their technological prowess is quite the achievement, though their ability pales in comparison to my own. I wonder why he abandoned them.
Hrm. Jawas soft things. Jawas not hunters, not survivors. Jedi is right to leave them.
But during my daily meditation beneath the pillars, I saw a vision on the cave wall that showed me the error of my assumptions.
I now know the true original people of Tatooine, the warriors whose knowledge I will use to stem the coming darkness.
What is he talking about? Who are these people he's gone to?
Do you know what he means?
Every Master afflicted with this illness has mentioned "the coming darkness."
This proves he's not well.
Aren't you Jedi always fighting the dark side, or whatever you call it? He seems perfectly sane to me.
That was pointless.
You really want to find this guy, don't you? I don't get it. He sounds perfectly sane to me.
Talk to the Jawas. That's where I left Master Eriz.
Tyrants! Damned tyrants the lot of you! Treating a grown man like he's a baby, like he can't take care of himself.
For a man who's supposed to be ill, he certainly is vociferous, which is to say, loud.
Hrm. Soft thing make a lot of noise for sick thing.
Lie down, Delk. And quit roaring--I swear a rancor with heartburn would make less noise than you.
I'll make as much noise as I want. Hey, Jedi! You a friend of Master Eriz? Get Darth Nurse here off my back, will you?
Master Eriz is exactly the reason I've come to talk to you.
You must be Rowan Delk.
Will you give us some time, nurse? I need to ask Delk about Master Eriz.
Excuse us, nurse.
She doesn't look Sith to me. But I did want to talk to you about Master Eriz.
Darth Nurse? I doubt it.
You two can talk--but don't let him fool you into letting him walk, Jedi. He's got the Sand Rot and bad.
Pfff. Man breathes in a little sand, and after twenty years guiding folks through the desert, he suddenly can't make decisions for himself.
What's it you wanted to know about Master Eriz?
It's a bit of a long story....
How should I start?
We believe Master Eriz is very ill....
He's sick.
It's important that I find Master Eriz as soon as possible....
I must talk to him.
I'm listening....
Jedi plague? Begging your pardon, but I don't believe it.
Sure, maybe some Masters--but not Master Eriz. He's the brightest, most level-headed guy I ever met.
We've seen this illness twist even the most level-headed Jedi Master.
He could still be at risk.
These Jedi Masters are among the order's best--that's what makes this plague so serious.
Of course he is.
Look, you want to talk to him, you're welcome to it. But I'm telling you he's just as sane as you or me.
I don't care what you think.
Hey, calm down. You want to find him, great. You'll see for yourself how sane he is.
When I left him, he was in the desert with them annoying little Jawas. Really impressed him how they managed to survive out there.
I'll go talk to these Jawas, then.
That's where I'll start.
What exactly are Jawas?
Jawas?
Crazy little alien fellas, run around in the desert trading scrap metal and fiddling with droids.
Do you know what Master Eriz was doing with the Jawas?
Why Jawas?
Studying them, far as I could tell. Trying to understand their crazy little culture.
They're friendly folk, the Jawas, even if they don't understand the meaning of the words "private property."
If Master Eriz isn't still with them, I'm sure they'll help you find him.
I'm sorry, I got nothing to say to you.
